column3: Latest;Phnom Penh: Various local media reports based on Facebook posts say on the morning of April 22
column5: parents who send children to CIA International School held a protest over tuition fees in Khan Sen Sok
column6: Phnom Penh.------According to the Facebook account
column8: who has sent two students at CIA school for more than 10 years
column10: which is offering lessons online but still charging full fees has remained silent and ignored questions from parents.  ------Fees for the school are reported to be between $ 4
column13: a price parents are finding hard to pay under the circumstances.------It is also mentioned that the parents have helped the school make a good profit for many years
column14: and now they ask the school to help the students and society
column15: rather than think of the money.------There are also------ allegations of a cover up------ involving a member of the owner’s family and a traffic accident.
